meanings.definition: A person who has returned, especially from the dead.
meanings.sent1: The town was filled with stories of revenants, those who had come back from the grave.
meanings.sent2: The legend spoke of revenants wandering the cemetery at night.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled nervously, pretending to be revenants rising from their pretend graves.
meanings.sent4: The memories of lost loved ones lingered like revenants in the minds of the grieving.
meanings.sent5: The image of the revenants clawing their way out of the earth was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A ghost or spirit that returns to haunt the living.
meanings.sent1: The old mansion was said to be haunted by revenants of the past.
meanings.sent2: The villagers whispered about revenants appearing in the foggy nights.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to think it was a revenant, startling the guests with its sudden appearances.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past lingered like revenants, haunting her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The revenants of regret haunted him, reminding him of his mistakes.
